Member Function Documentation

wxTextOutputStream * executeCmd (  wxString  command,
wxEvtHandler *  listener,
bool  isSynch
)  [private]
 

private executeCmd Starts the command in the remote shell. Putting proper wrappings around it. This puts stores the necessary info into the ProcessInfo list. Not much is done differently for Synchronous Commands except recording that it is or isn't. This is a generic function. The synchronous wait-loop would need to be done else where (executeSyncCommand). ASYNCHRONOUS (relatively)

Parameters:
command wxString command
listener wxEvtHandler * who'll get the events
isSynch bool Whether this is being run synchronously or not.
Returns:
wxTextOutputStream * StdIn for the newly started process
Author:
David Czechowski
Date:
04-23-2004

Definition at line 296 of file plinkconnect.cpp.

wxTextOutputStream * executeCommand (  wxString  command,
wxEvtHandler *  listener
) 
 

public executeCommand Used to start an Asynchronous process on the server. All remaining inter actions will be asynchronous through events (Termination & output) This should only be called if isConnected is true - doesn't make sense otherwise. ASYNCHRONOUS (relatively)

Parameters:
command wxString What command to run.
listener wxEvtHandler * Who will receive term&output events
Returns:
wxTextOutputStream * StdIn for the newly started process
Author:
David Czechowski
Date:
04-23-2004

wxString executeSyncCommand (  wxString  command  ) 
 

public executeSyncCommand This will execute "command" on the remote server and wait until it terminates. Then the output will be returned. WARNING: if 'command' is going to be expecting user interaction, this will lock chameleon. SYNCHRONOUS

Parameters:
command wxString what to execute on the remote server.
Returns:
wxString The resulting output
Author:
David Czechowski
Date:
04-23-2004

bool getIsConnected (   ) 
 

public getIsConnected If I am "Connected" it means, I can execute things remotely. This is SYNCHRONOUS because if I'm not in a settled state yet, I go into a wait loop

Returns:
bool I'm eaither connected or not

bool getIsSettled (   ) 
 

public getIsSettled The use of this would be in similar situations as getIsConnected, except this is ASYNCHRONOUS. "Settled" simply means, that an isConnected status check will not go into a wait-loop

Returns:
bool If true, getIsConnected can be run without entering a wait- loop.
Author:
David Czechowski

void onTerminate (  wxProcessEvent &  event  )  [private]
 

private onTerminate When a process terminates this gets called. It will determine which which process it came from, then (if appropriate) send an event to it's listener.

Parameters:
event wxProcessEvent & the termination event

void parseOutput (  ProcessInfo *  p,
wxString  output,
wxString  errLog = ""
)  [private]
 

private parseOutput This is where OutputEvents are created, and where state-transitions occur I make liberal use of tokens to determine the success/failure of what I'm doing. I have a shell for each connection I make. I know when a command has ended by appending an echo command to the end, and waiting until it shows up. I know I have made a successful connection by watching for the success-token

Parameters:
proc ProcessInfo * The process which has output
output wxString What the output is.
errlog wxString [=""] This is useless except for during PS_STARTING
Returns:
void
Author:
David Czechowski
Date:
04-23-2004

Definition at line 376 of file plinkconnect.cpp.

void PollTick (   ) 
 

public PollTick wxWindows' Process stuff is not event driven. So, I need to poll the processes. This method gets called to do the polling. Which means this needs to get called periodically

Returns:
void

void setLogin (  wxString  host,
wxString  user,
wxString  pass
) 
 

public setLogin Anything that is "" will be left unchanged. This will reset and restart the connection/s whether things have changed or not. Which means this can be used to do a reset (passing all ""). If hostname, username, or pass change, it only makes sense to reset. ASYNCHRONOUS

Parameters:
host wxString new hostname
user wxString new username
pass wxString new passphrase
Returns:
void
Author:
David Czechowski
